div.class: custom_74621 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

br.span: Lindsay ISD is postponing the graduation ceremony scheduled for May 22 to a later date due to COVID-19 concerns. We have now scheduled the graduation ceremony for Friday, July 10 at 7:00 PM. It will be held at Centennial Hall. LISD is doing everything that we can to ensure the Class of 2020 is able to celebrate their graduation with family and friends.

p.span: Student Registration is May 1-15

Registration for 2020-2021 school year will be online for Lindsay ISD. Registration will be available online May 1 through May 15 ONLY. You will be able to access registration and directions thru a link on the Lindsay ISD homepage or by going directly to Parent Portal.Â No paperwork will be sent home. All students MUST register online.
If you have any problem with online registration, please contact the High School or Elementary office between 8:00 am and 12:00 pm Monday through Thursday during registration.
Library Books Due April 30

br.span: All library books are due back by Thursday, April 30. Books not returned will be charged to the student. This applies to both the elementary and high school libraries.

p.span: Books may be dropped off at the campus offices, 9:00 am to noon, Monday-Thursday.
Academic All-State Basketball Team Named

br.span: Congratulations to Cayden Rains, Jake Metzler and Zane Hughes for being named to the Academic All State Teams for Texas High School Coaches Association and the Texas Association of Basketball Coaches.

hr.span: Schools Closed Through End of School Year

p.span: On Friday, Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced that schools will remain closed for the rest of the school year. Additionally, all UIL spring activities are canceled.

Lindsay ISD will continue to do our best to provide quality instruction for our students during this time. We will also continue to provide meal service for those who qualify. Please be encouraged to communicate with your childâ€™s teachers and principals as you have questions.
See the Year in Pictures

br.span: We created a six minute slideshow that covers August 2019 to March 2020. Itâ€™s a lot of sports but there are other school activities, too. See it here.

p.span: Help the Yearbook Tell Our Story

br.span: Wow, this school year is one for the books! Your yearbook staff is working on a special section in the yearbook about the changes to our year; they need your help.

p.span: Please send photos and descriptions of what our students' lives are like during the quarantine to Barbara Westbrook at bwestbrook@lindsayisd.org.
Student Meals Available from LISD

We are providing meals to all LISD students who qualify. Meals are served in a â€œTo Goâ€ format. They are available from 11:00-12:00 each day that we are not in session due to closure. If a student needs a meal but it canâ€™t be picked up during the allotted time or if the meal needs to be distributed to the studentâ€™s home, please let us know and we will get the meal to the student. Please contact your childâ€™s campus principal if you would like to participate in the meal program.
School Board Election Rescheduled

br.span: The next school board election has been rescheduled for Tuesday, November 3, 2020.Â Early voting will be October 19-30 at the Courthouse Annex in Gainesville.

p.span: The location for the November 3 election will be at Conrad Hall.
New Edition of the Knight Light is Posted

br.span: Even though they have not been in a classroom for a few weeks, Mrs. Vaughnâ€™s sixth graders have completed a new edition of the Knight Light. See it here.

p.span: FCCLA Students Compete at State

br.span: Congratulations to the State STAR contest participants.

p.span: Riya Dax, Ella Dieter, and Macey Hawkins competed in Food Innovations Level 2 and placed 2nd at the FCCLA State Virtual Competition. The first and second place teams are scheduled to compete at Nationals in Washington DC, July 5-9.
Logan Martin competed in FCCLA STAR Event Professional Presentation Level 3. Her platform was Home is Where the Heart Is. She earned second place at Region, third place at State.

hr.span: Sixth Grade Science Students Stay Busy

div.span: Learning isnâ€™t cancelled at Lindsay Elementary! Students in Mrs. Hermesâ€™ 6th grade science class made delicious models representing the layers of the earth. Details are on our elementary page.

br.span: The Lindsay ISD Board of Trustees has approved the school calendar for the 2020-2021 school year. See it here.

p.span: Check out our Lost and Found

img.alt: lost and found collection that is in the cafeteria
img.span: Is your Knight missing a coat, hoodie, or sweat shirt? We have a collection of goods in the cafeteria. Come by on weekday mornings to claim items.

p.span: UIL Announces Alignments for Sports

br.span: The University Interscholastic League has completed next yearâ€™s district alignments for sports and academics. Details can be found on these pages:

br.br: Track, Golf, Tennis, and Academics (link goes to the track page)

p.span: Follett eBooks for Elementary Readers

br.span: Here is a link for Follett Books for elementary students. Login is guest, password is follett. After you log in, select a Lightbox book and enjoy. We have free access to this service through June 30.These books work with every browserÂ except Microsoft Edge.

hr.span: How to Find Old Photo Galleries

p.span: Photo galleries that are no longer on the main page can be found on the page for that particular sport or activity. For example, football galleries can be found on our football page (click Athletics, then Football). Cheerleader and pep rally galleries can be found on the cheerleading page (click Activities, then Cheerleading).

hr.hr:
Â
Lindsay ISD believes in delivering quality customer service in all aspects of our daily operations.Â While this does not mean that every person gets exactly what they want, for that would be impossible to deliver, it does mean that we value all stake holders and we will listen to each and every concern that a community member may have.Â We strive each and every day to have quality programs in a healthy, clean, safe environment for our students.Â We appreciate the support of the Lindsay ISD Community.Â Please let us know if we can help you in any way.
